results.title: Dirty Harry
results.creator_credit: Malpaso Company, Warner Bros Pictures and Don Siegel
results.brief_description: Harry Callaghan is a tough, streetwise San Francisco cop whom they call Dirty Harry. In this classic film, you will see why. You will also see why Clint Eastwood’s reputation is secure. No other actor can match his presence. He is magnetising in his portrayal as the shoot-first-ask-questions-later law enforcer who must hunt a psychotic roof-top killer who has slain two people and has kidnapped a girl and threatens to suffocate her if his ransom demands are not met. Harry will get him… one way or the other… no matter what the “system” prescribes. Moody cinematography and stunning location filming propel the story and capitalise upon Eastwood’s commanding presence. Watch this film and ask yourself: Do you feel lucky?

results.title: Dirty deeds
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Bryan Brown, Deborah Balderstone and David Caesar
results.brief_description: David Caesar takes an irreverent swipe at the gangster genre with this film set in the milieu of the 60s crime scene in Australia, which owes much to the spirit of more contemporary crime films such as Guy Richie’s “Lock, Stock and two smoking barrels”. It is 1969 and the criminal underbelly of Sydney’s King’s Cross has proven to be a lucrative business for notorious crime boss, Barry Ryan (Bryan Brown). His small-scale local operation is threatened however when the American Mafia catch wind of Barry’s profitable dealings and decide to muscle their way in. The scene is set for a David and Golliath battle between dodgy crooks and dodgier crooks! Caesar’s script is based partly on truth, particularly events surrounding the infiltration of the American mafia into Australian crime. “Dirty Deeds” uses this as a basis however to comment on the subsequent Americanization of Australian culture, while playfully poking fun at the Aussie laissez faire attitude vs American corporate efficiency. Cast also includes: Toni Collette, Sam Neill, John Goodman, Sam Worthington, Kestie Morassi, William McInnes.

results.title: Dirty dancing
results.creator_credit: Vestron Pictures, Linda Gottlieb and Emile Ardolino
results.brief_description: The Summer of 1963 is one that Baby (Jennifer Grey) will never forget. While holidaying in the Catskills she stumbles across the daring and exciting world of the dancing staff; driven by the stirring music and sensual moves, known as “dirty dancing”. She becomes the star pupil of the handsome dance instructor, Johnny (Patrick Swayze), and finds herself becoming more that just his dancing partner. Cast includes Cynthia Rhodes, Jerry Orbach and Jack Weston.

results.title: Dirty business
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Ian Fowler and Rob Grant
results.brief_description: A comedy in which two young men turn to burglary for easy money, but find their attempts foiled when one finds himself locked in a bathroom. Stars Jan Marnell, Simon Beattie, George Vidalis and Alethea MacGrath.

results.title: Dirty Beasts
results.brief_description: Roald Dahl has created a colourful menagerie of extraordinary beasts including a crocodile with an appetite for children, a cow with silver and gold wings and a hungry creature that lives in the tummy of a young boy and constantly demands food.

results.title: Dirt Track Racing for PC
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD envelope, install instructions in cardboard box
results.brief_description: In Dirt Track Racing, the player controls a vehicle in a race around oval or figure-eight dirt tracks. The game features three classes of cars - stock, pro stock, and late model - which can be enhanced with high performance parts. The game allows you to either play one race or go through a career mode where the player starts with next to nothing and slowly accumulates more money and better cars through winning races and gaining sponsors. The player can also race up to 10 people online.

results.title: Dirt cheap
results.creator_credit: Marg Clancy, Ned Lander and David Hay
results.brief_description: This film pays particular attention to uranium mining and the events and controversy surrounding the signing of the Ranger Mining Agreement - an agreement negotiated to permit a large scale, open-cut uranium mining operation at Jabiru, N.T. Whilst focusing on this event, the film explores all the issues involved in the mining of uranium in Australia.

Whilst focusing on this event, the film explores all the issues involved in the mining of uranium in Australia.

results.title: Dirt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Canned Pictures, Trudi Callon, Kirk Hassig, Michael Covert and Trace Fraim
results.brief_description: Two daft Texan brothers, Scooter and Junior, are left bereft and domestically helpless when their dear old Ma dies. They hatch a plan to get a woman to replace her, searching strip bars, and even approaching a prostitute to fulfil the role. When these attempts fail they kidnap DeDe (Tara Chocol), who, due to the sadistic nature of her marriage, decides to stay with them. After DeDe’s husband, a Texas Ranger, burns their house down, the brothers rob banks to support the burgeoning family. Junior, who has emotional problems, falls for DeDe whilst Scooter forms an attraction to a bank teller, Margaret, at a local branch they frequent. “Dirt” is a black comedy and farce that apes the style and energy of a Coen brothers’ film (in particular Raising Arizona) but screenwriter, director and star Michael Covert fails to achieve the same distinctly outlandish tone. Despite some slyly inspired moments, and witty one-liners, Covert ultimately opts for conventional narrative outcomes over his subversive intentions. The film trots out a slew of familiar Texan movie cliches (bigoted and corrupt police, violent husbands, dim-witted simple folk) whilst amid all the darkly themed humour, it attempts to make some salient points about the futility of male violence. Also stars Tracy Fraim, Patrick Warburton and Olivia Rosewood.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Canned Pictures, Trudi Callon, Kirk Hassig, Michael Covert and Trace Fraim
results.description: Two daft Texan brothers, Scooter and Junior, are left bereft and domestically helpless when their dear old Ma dies. They hatch a plan to get a woman to replace her, searching strip bars, and even approaching a prostitute to fulfil the role. When these attempts fail they kidnap DeDe (Tara Chocol), who, due to the sadistic nature of her marriage, decides to stay with them. After DeDe’s husband, a Texas Ranger, burns their house down, the brothers rob banks to support the burgeoning family. Junior, who has emotional problems, falls for DeDe whilst Scooter forms an attraction to a bank teller, Margaret, at a local branch they frequent. “Dirt” is a black comedy and farce that apes the style and energy of a Coen brothers’ film (in particular Raising Arizona) but screenwriter, director and star Michael Covert fails to achieve the same distinctly outlandish tone. Despite some slyly inspired moments, and witty one-liners, Covert ultimately opts for conventional narrative outcomes over his subversive intentions. The film trots out a slew of familiar Texan movie cliches (bigoted and corrupt police, violent husbands, dim-witted simple folk) whilst amid all the darkly themed humour, it attempts to make some salient points about the futility of male violence. Also stars Tracy Fraim, Patrick Warburton and Olivia Rosewood.

results.title: Directors of the future
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A ‘mokumentary’ following the trials and tribulations of future ‘Star Director’ Izabella Dazs’ career. We begin the film as she is formulating an idea for her film and we finish by seeing her end product, “Les pommes du mal”.

results.title: Director's cut
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Stephanie Moore
results.brief_description: Stephanie reflects on her time as director of Positive Women, a support and advocacy organisation for women with HIV. She is inspired by the courage of the women who must come to terms with a disease that can kill them or significantly reduce their quality of life.
